replies.author: mshabarov

timeline.bodyText:
Since ComboBox is still the only component with inbuilt filtering, it might be OK even still to just force the components to implement this method always (not have default implementation at all) and then make CB throw in the implementation, and point to the method with the filter converter instead, which would only be in CB.
I cannot say at the moment which is better or worse option.

replies.bodyText: Alright, I like this idea, because: 1. The implementation in custom components/addons might be not only in delegating to setItems(DataProvider<T, F> dataProvider) 2. Component's author will be responsible for handling the input data provider in implementation and he will decide whether ignore the filter or not.

I think if combo box is the only component that needs this type of callback, then it can have a data view implementation which get those from the component when it constructs the data view for itself.
